classes.cCustomNote: Any Free Elective course can go here. 5 units of Free Electives are required. SCM150 workshops for Math/Science courses are recommended for the remaining units.
Any Free Elective course can go here. 5 units of Free Electives are required. SCM150 workshops for Math/Science courses are recommended for the remaining units.
Any Free Elective course can go here. 5 units of Free Electives are required. SCM150 workshops for Math/Science courses are recommended for the remaining units.

This is the general curriculum required for students who do not declare a concentration. Courses taken to meet a major support requirement cannot be double-counted in the concentration or general curriculum.

Select from the following: BIO321, BIO322, BIO323, BIO324, BIO329, BIO335, BIO336, BIO429; BOT313; MCRO224, MCRO402; MSCI324.

One course from each of the following GE areas must be completed: A1, A2, A3, B1, B2, Upper-Division B, C1, C2, Lower-Division C, Upper-Division C, D1, D2, Upper-Division D, Lower Division E, Lower Division F, and GE Elective. Upper-Division B, Upper-Division C, and Upper-Division D should be taken only after Junior standing is reached (90 units). Refer to the online catalog for GE course selection, United States Cultural Pluralism (USCP), and Graduation Writing Requirement (GWR). USCP requirement can be satisfied by some (but not all) courses within GE categories: Upper-Division B, C1, Upper-Division C, D1, D2, Upper-Division D, or E.
Choose one of the following: BIO361, BIO434, BIO435.
Choose one of the following: CHEM216 or CHEM312.

This is the default curriculum required for students who do not declare a concentration. Courses taken to meet a major support requirement cannot be double-counted in the concentration or general curriculum.

20 units of Upper-Division electives required. See catalog for course options. Minimum of 12 units of 400-level courses, and 8 units of 300-level courses. Consultation with an advisor is recommended. Excess units applied to "Approved Electives".

Students can attempt to fulfill the requirement after 90 earned units; students should complete the requirement before senior year. Any GWR course or GWR exam can go here. Refer to current catalog for prerequisites.
Choose one of the following: BIO461 or BIO462.

This is the default curriculum required for students who do not declare a concentration. Courses taken to meet a major support requirement cannot be double-counted in the concentration or general curriculum.

19 units of Approved Electives required. See catalog for course options. Consultation with an advisor is recommended. No double-counting with Major requirements. Upper-division courses may be needed to satisfy the 60-unit degree requirement.
